metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10728 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in Suricata before 3.1.2. If an ICMPv4 error packet is received as the first packet on a flow in the to_client direction, it confuses the rule grouping lookup logic. The toclient inspection will then continue with the wrong rule group. This can lead to missed detection.

criterions.comment: suricata: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
